review: My only issue isn't really the Chromecast, it is my wifi signal isn't strong where it is.  I do have wired ethernet available, but it doesn't have a way to take advantage of that. ... Bummer.  Due to having a dual band router, I have dual-band wifi router available with a  strong 5GHz signal where it is, but it ONLY uses 2.4GHz not 5GHz channels.I did juryrig a way to get more wifi so I could test, and it works well for my needs.  My daughter has one and it works well for her at her house.At least it is cheap and for me I am just counting it as an experiment that didn't succeed like I had hoped.For what it is, I am impressed.  It just isn't what I had 'assumed' it would be.
author: servant74

author: Mr. Crawford

review: I was skeptical that I needed this when I already use other devices as media hubs.  It's one of the best purchases I've made. You need a little bit of geek know how (maybe not the best gift for your elderly grandparents) but it's also really simple to use (even my wife uses it regularly and easily.) Streams whatever you want it to stream with enough tinkering around, although we just use it for Netflix mainly. Originally bought it for main TV, but now it has given the non-cable bedroom TV new life. We love it.
author: Anchovies

review: I thought this thing would pick up internet stations like a Roku or something like that, so was a bit disappointed.  Can't find any need or use for it.  Works great for what it does, was able to broadcast from my laptop and my phone to the tv, but don't really need to do that.
